experiments.input_variable: HDPE mass ratio in the mixture

constants.name: Pyrolysis temperature
evidence_sentences: a pyrolysis temperature of 540 ◦C was set using the PID controller.

constants.name: Heating rate
evidence_sentences: and a heating rate of 6 ◦C/min was set

constants.name: Pressure inside reactor
evidence_sentences: The pressure inside the reactor was maintained at 30 kPa, and a pressure-relief valve was fitted to release vapor if the pressure exceeded the required threshold.

outcome_groups.description: Percentage of oil produced from pyrolysis of different plastic mixtures.
evidence_sentences: The highest oil production was found when the mixture PPO111 was used in the pyrolysis and lowest was found when the mixture PPO811 was used. The oil yield percentages were 45.2%, 43.6%, 41.7%, and 39% for mixtures with HDPE mass ratios of 1, 2, 4, and 8 respectively.

outcome_groups.description: Density measurements of the diesel obtained from waste plastic pyrolysis.
evidence_sentences: The density of PPO and DC was measured experimentally at 15 °C and presented in Fig. 5(b). The figure shows that most diesel obtained from the pyrolysis has density close to the minimum Australian standard.
The highest cetane index was found in distilled diesel cut sample PPO811 (58) and lowest was found from PPO111 (46).

outcome_groups.description: Amount of Aromatic Hydrocarbons (AH) and Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbons (PAH) in crude oil and distilled diesel.
evidence_sentences: The lowest amount of AH was documented for PPO811 sample which was 24 wt% and 18.81 wt% for crude PPO and distilled diesel fraction respectively.

constants.name: Density at 15°C
evidence_sentences: The density of PPO and DC was measured experimentally at 15 °C and presented in Fig. 5(b).

outcome_groups.description: Measured KV values for crude pyrolysis oil and distilled diesel cut.
evidence_sentences: The KV of DC is close to the minimum range of values defined by Australian standard but the KV of crude PPO is below the minimum standard.

outcome_groups.description: Density measurements of the diesel obtained from waste plastic pyrolysis.
evidence_sentences: The density of PPO and DC was measured experimentally at 15 °C and presented in Fig. 5(b). The figure shows that most diesel obtained from the pyrolysis has density close to the minimum Australian standard.

outcome_groups.description: Measured HHV values for crude PPO and distilled diesel.
evidence_sentences: The HHV of crude PPO was found between 44 and 45.2 MJ/kg which like the conventional diesel fuel.
